text: Tony Rutter (24 September 1941 â€“ 24 March 2020) was a British professional motorcycle road racer. He was a street circuit specialist. He competed in the Grand Prix motorcycle world championships from 1969 to 1976. He won seven Isle of Man TT races between 1973 and 1985. Rutter was the TT Formula Two World Champion each year from 1981 to 1984. His son, Michael Rutter, also became a motorcycle racer.
